contents.item: Circumstances will change and things will be fine, just hold on a little more
contents.owner: Ishmael Beah, A Long Way Gone: Memoirs of a Boy Soldier

contents.item: If you meet a woman of whatever complexion who sails her life with strength and grace and assurance, talk to her! And what you will find is that there has been a suffering, that at some time she has left herself for hanging dead.
contents.owner: Sena Jeter Naslund, Ahab's Wife, or The Star-Gazer

contents.item: I never could understand why some writers treat women as helpless. Every woman I know is strong in her own unique way.
Speaking very generally, I find that women are spiritually, emotionally, and often physically stronger than men.

Harriet loved her new persona. As Maxine, she was courageous and accomplished, a woman of sophistication equally at home in Cannes or on the Indian subcontinent. As Maxine she didn't walk, she strode; she did not merely see, but beheld. The very air she breathed was bracing. Here was a conqueror of worlds.

You are first and foremost a person. A reckless, foolish person, but a person nonetheless. If I ever say you are not permitted to do something, rest assured that the last reason I would ever say so would be because you are a girl.
contents.owner: Renee Ahdieh, Flame in the Mist

contents.item: Etta saw the way Sophia took a deep breathe, set her shoulders back, and moved with practiced grace on her way out — and she understood something about the other girl, truly understood for the first time. Sophia wanted it, when she was only ever sent out.
Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
contents.owner: Corrie ten Boom, Clippings from My Notebook

contents.item: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.
The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places.
contents.owner: Ernest Hemingway, A Farewell to Arms

contents.item: A strong woman who recklessly throws away her strength, she is worse than a weak woman who has never had any strength to throw away.
contents.owner: Thomas Hardy, Tess of the D'Urbervilles

contents.item: Temper us in fire, and we grow stronger. When we suffer, we survive.
contents.owner: Cassandra Clare, City of Heavenly Fire

contents.item: You feel your strength in the experience of pain.
You can't really be strong until you can see a funny side to things.
In the end, some of your greatest pains become your greatest strengths.
I wonder if I will ever have the strength to hold onto something. Or if I will always be someone who destroys.
Strength isn't about bearing a cross of grief or shame. Strength comes from choosing your own path, and living with the consequences.
Go so far away that you stop being afraid of not coming back.
contents.owner: Eve Ensler, I am an Emotional Creature

contents.item: I used to think you were weak and just didn't fight back ... but now, honestly, I think you're actually pretty tough. It takes a hell of a lot of strength to not complain and lash out.
Tears shed for self are tears of weakness, but tears shed for others are a sign of strength.
